newsitem.title: UKRAINE: SOCCER-UKRAINE GRAB LATE WINNER TO SINK PORTUGAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-UKRAINE GRAB LATE WINNER TO SINK PORTUGAL.

text.p: Luis Figo looked to have salvaged a World Cup point for Portugal with an 83rd minute equaliser against Ukraine on Saturday only to see Yuri Maksimov grab the winner for the home side two minutes from time.

The 2-1 defeat left the fancied Portuguese with just one point from two games after an earlier draw with Armenia and put Ukraine, also winners over Northern Ireland, top of qualifying group nine. Favourites Germany have yet to play.
Serhiy Popov gave Ukraine an early lead, following up with a header after Portuguese goalkeeper Vitor Baia failed to hold on to the midfielder's own blistering shot in the fifth minute.
Portugal piled on the pressure. The Ukrainians were limited to counter-attacks, especially in the second half, but held out until Figo's late goal.

Ukraine: 1-Oleh Suslov, 2-Yuri Dmytrulin, 3-Victor Skrypnyk, 4-Olexander Holovko, 5-Vladyslav Vashchuk, 6-Sergiy Popov, 7-Yuri Maksimov, 8-Hennady Zubov (Serhiy Yesin 58th), 9-Vitaly Kosovsky, 10-Valery Kryventsov (Oleh Luzhny 69th), 11-Serhiy Rebrov (Timerlan Guseynov 81st).

Portugal: 1-Vitor Baia, 2-Carlos Secretario, 3-Rui Oliveira (Antonio Foiha 16th), 4-Oceano Cruz (Paulo Bento 64th), 5-Sousa Fernando, 6-Helder Cristovao, 7-Luis Figo, 8-Joao Pinto, 9-Ricardo Sa Pinto (Paulo Alves 64th), 10-Rui Costa, 11-Joao Santos.
